author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: Linked Discourses 1
2. The Garden of Delight
20. With Samiddhi
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tapodārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodā tenupasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.
segments.en: Then Venerable Samiddhi rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.

segments.pli: Tapode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
segments.en: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.

segments.pli: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ tapodaṃ obhāsetvā yena āyasmā samiddhi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā vehāsaṃ ṭhitā āyasmantaṃ samiddhiṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire hot springs, went up to Samiddhi, and, standing in the air, addressed him in verse:
“Mendicant, you seek alms before you eat;
you wouldn’t seek alms after eating.
But you should eat first, then seek alms:
don’t let the time pass you by.”
“I actually don’t know the time;
it’s hidden and unseen.
That’s why I seek alms before eating,
so that the time may not pass me by!”

segments.pli: Atha kho sā devatā pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhahitvā āyasmantaṃ samiddhiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then that deity landed on the ground and said to Samiddhi,

segments.pli: “daharo tvaṃ, bhikkhu, pabbajito susu kāḷakeso, bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato, paṭhamena vayasā, anikkīḷitāvī kāmesu.
segments.en: “You’ve gone forth while young, mendicant. You’re black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life, and you’ve never flirted with sensual pleasures.
Enjoy human sensual pleasures!
Don’t give up what is visible in the present to chase after what takes effect over time.”

segments.pli: “Na khvāhaṃ, āvuso, sandiṭṭhikaṃ hitvā kālikaṃ anudhāvāmi.
segments.en: “I’m not, good sir;

segments.pli: Kālikañca khvāhaṃ, āvuso, hitvā sandiṭṭhikaṃ anudhāvāmi.
segments.en: I’m giving up what takes effect over time to chase after what is visible in the present.

segments.pli: Kālikā hi, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā; ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
segments.en: For the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures take effect over time, with much suffering and distress, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks.

segments.pli: Sandiṭṭhiko ayaṃ dhammo akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī”ti.
segments.en: But this teaching is visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”

segments.pli: “Kathañca, bhikkhu, kālikā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo?
segments.en: “But in what way, mendicant, has the Buddha said that sensual pleasures take effect over time, with much suffering and distress, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks?

segments.pli: Kathaṃ sandiṭṭhiko ayaṃ dhammo akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī”ti?
segments.en: And how is this teaching visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”

segments.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhunāgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ.
segments.en: “I’m junior, good sir, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching and training.
I’m not able to explain this in detail.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho rājagahe viharati tapodārāme.
segments.en: But the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha is staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
You should go to him and ask about this matter.

segments.pli: Yathā te bhagavā byākaroti tathā naṃ dhāreyyāsī”ti.
segments.en: And you should remember it in line with the Buddha’s answer.”

segments.pli: “Na kho, bhikkhu, sukaro so bhagavā amhehi upasaṅkamituṃ, aññāhi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi parivuto.
segments.en: “It’s not easy for us to approach the Buddha, as he is surrounded by other illustrious deities.

segments.pli: Sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, taṃ bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṃ puccheyyāsi, mayampi āgaccheyyāma dhammassavanāyā”ti.
segments.en: If you go to the Buddha and ask him about this matter, we’ll come along and listen to the teaching.”

segments.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā samiddhi tassā devatāya paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā samiddhi bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, good sir,” Venerable Samiddhi replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. Then he added:

segments.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhante, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodā tenupasaṅkamiṃ gattāni parisiñcituṃ.
Tapode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsiṃ gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
Atha kho, bhante, aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ tapodaṃ obhāsetvā yenāhaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā vehāsaṃ ṭhitā imāya gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
Evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhante, taṃ devataṃ gāthāya paccabhāsiṃ:
Atha kho, bhante, sā devatā pathaviyaṃ patiṭṭhahitvā maṃ etadavoca:
‘daharo tvaṃ, bhikkhu, pabbajito susu kāḷakeso, bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato, paṭhamena vayasā, anikkīḷitāvī kāmesu.
Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, taṃ devataṃ etadavocaṃ:
‘na khvāhaṃ, āvuso, sandiṭṭhikaṃ hitvā kālikaṃ anudhāvāmi;
kālikañca khvāhaṃ, āvuso, hitvā sandiṭṭhikaṃ anudhāvāmi.
Kālikā hi, āvuso, kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā; ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.
Sandiṭṭhiko ayaṃ dhammo akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
Evaṃ vutte, bhante, sā devatā maṃ etadavoca:
‘kathañca, bhikkhu, kālikā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā; ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo?
Kathaṃ sandiṭṭhiko ayaṃ dhammo akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti?
Evaṃ vuttāhaṃ, bhante, taṃ devataṃ etadavocaṃ:
‘ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhunāgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, na tāhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.
Ayaṃ so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho rājagahe viharati tapodārāme.
Yathā te bhagavā byākaroti tathā naṃ dhāreyyāsī’ti.
Evaṃ vutte, bhante, sā devatā maṃ etadavoca:
‘na kho, bhikkhu, sukaro so bhagavā amhehi upasaṅkamituṃ, aññāhi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi parivuto.
Sace kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, taṃ bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṃ puccheyyāsi, mayampi āgaccheyyāma dhammassavanāyā’ti.
Sace, bhante, tassā devatāya saccaṃ vacanaṃ, idheva sā devatā avidūre”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, if that deity spoke the truth, he’ll be close by.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, sā devatā āyasmantaṃ samiddhiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, that deity said to Samiddhi,
“Ask, mendicant, ask! For I have arrived.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā taṃ devataṃ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha addressed the deity in verse:
“Sentient beings who perceive the visible,
become established in the visible.
Not understanding the visible,
they come under the yoke of Death.
But having fully understood the visible,
they don’t identify as a seer,
for they have nothing

segments.pli: Yena naṃ vajjā na tassa atthi;
segments.en: by which they might be described.
Tell me if you understand, spirit.”

segments.pli: “Na khvāhaṃ, bhante, imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi.
segments.en: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

segments.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tathā bhāsatu yathāhaṃ imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ jāneyyan”ti.
segments.en: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”
“If you think that ‘I’m equal,
special, or worse’, you’ll get into arguments.
Unwavering in the face of the three discriminations,
you’ll have no thought ‘I’m equal or special’.
Tell me if you understand, spirit.”

segments.pli: “Imassapi khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa na vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi.
segments.en: “I don’t understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.

segments.pli: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tathā bhāsatu yathāhaṃ imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ jāneyyan”ti.
segments.en: Please teach me this matter so I can understand the detailed meaning.”
“Judging is given up, conceit rejected;
craving for name and form is cut off right here.
They’ve cut the ties, untroubled and free of hope.
Though gods and humans search for them

segments.pli: Devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
segments.en: in this world and the world beyond, they never find them,
not in heaven nor in any abode.
Tell me if you understand, spirit.”

segments.pli: “Imassa khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi—
segments.en: “This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement:
“You should never do anything bad
by speech or mind or body in all the world.
Having given up sensual pleasures, mindful and aware,
you shouldn’t keep doing what’s painful and pointless.”

suttaplex.blurb: A deity tries to tempt a monk to first enjoy sensual pleasures and then go forth.
